channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

item.title: 'Greatest witch hunt:' Trump blasts special counsel appointment
Fox CEO forced out in sexual harassment scandal, dies aged 77
White House PR in chaos: Conway interview offered, then canceled
Erdogan entourage's history of violence
item.description: The bloody brawl this week on Washington, DC's Embassy Row is not the first time members of Turkish president Recep Tayyip Erdogan's entourage have been filmed fighting in public.

item.title: Ultimate insider Rouhani vows change in Iran
item.description: He may be the ultimate insider, but Hassan Rouhani is running like the anti-establishment candidate.

item.title: US official: ISIS creating chemical weapons cell
item.description: US intelligence believes ISIS is bringing together all of its experts on chemical weapons from Iraq and Syria into a new "chemical weapons cell," according to a US official.

item.title: Venezuela: So few supplies, so much pain
item.description: A lack of food, of medicine, even water is hurting the most vulnerable in Venezuela. CNN went undercover to report the impact on some of the country's children.

item.title: Chris Cornell ended final performance of life with song about death
item.description: In my time of dying, I want nobody to mourn

item.title: Brazil's president accused of bribery
item.description: Brazil's leadership lurched into another bribery scandal Wednesday, as one of the country's biggest newspapers accused President Michel Temer of paying a former senate colleague hush money.

item.title: Faced with slaughter they fled, now their haven teeters on brink
item.description: Imvepi Refugee Camp, Uganda: Seventeen-year-old Blessing Akujo stands motionless, watching the flatbed trucks fill with their human cargo in the midday sun.

item.title: McGregor signs contract to fight Mayweather
item.description: The dream "billion dollar" superfight is now halfway to becoming reality.

item.title: Facebook fined $122 million over misleading EU officials
#Grime4Corbyn: UK grime scene gets political
item.description: Grime music is getting political in the UK.

item.title: The F1 driver who still rides a scooter
item.description: Red Bull Racing's Max Verstappen is the youngest man to top a Formula One podium in the history of the sport, having triumphed in his Red Bull debut at last year's Spanish Grand Prix.

item.title: Shake-up for round-the-world race
item.description: One hull or two? Organizers have opted for both in a radical development for sailing's premier around-the-world race.

item.title: Dutch King reveals he secretly piloted KLM flights
item.description: They don't call KLM "Royal Dutch Airlines" for nothing.

item.title: Obama has some harsh words for Trump
item.description: While President Donald Trump is embroiled in controversy -- with regularity -- Barack and Michelle Obama are enjoying a less-harried lifestyle these days, at least according to the cover story in the new issue of People magazine.

item.title: Can South Korea and China patch things up over THAAD?
item.description: Jeong Min-young is worried.

item.title: Russia-North Korea ferry starts service
item.description: A cargo-passenger ferry service linking Russia and North Korea completed its first trip Thursday.

item.title: Man freed early from prison -- now held by immigration court
item.description: A Colorado man who was mistakenly freed from prison, rearrested, then freed again is facing a new hurdle: immigration court.

item.title: Turkish security 'involved in Washington protester assault'
item.description: Turkish security officials were involved in Tuesday's assault of protesters against President Recep Tayyip Erdogan outside the Turkish ambassador's residence in Washington, two law enforcement sources tell CNN.

item.title: Princess gives up her royal status -- for love
item.description: Japan's Princess Mako is giving up her royal status -- all in the name of love.

item.title: Apparent airplane debris found off coast of Bahamas
item.description: The US Coast Guard is searching for survivors after finding what is believed to be airplane debris 15 miles east of an island in the Bahamas on Tuesday.

item.title: Brad Pitt contemplates life with Colbert
item.description: Brad Pitt appearance on the "Late Show" turned existential on Tuesday night when he and Stephen Colbert engaged a bro down that took place on a picnic blanket under the starry sky.

item.title: Out of prison, Chelsea Manning looks to explore life as a woman
item.description: Chelsea Manning, the former Army intelligence analyst behind one of the largest classified information leaks in US history, was released from military prison early Wednesday morning, an Army spokeswoman said.

item.title: Texas girl chokes on fidget spinner part
item.description: Fidget spinners are driving many adults crazy, but one Texas woman is warning about her daughter's dangerous experience.

item.title: Gisele Bunchen: Brady has had concussion
item.description: Gisele Bunchen said in an interview on CBS that her husband, New England Patriots quarterback Tom Brady, had a concussion last year and has had others.

item.title: '$168M' teen powers Monaco
item.description: Paris Saint Germain's era of dominance is over and the Ligue 1 trophy is once again in the hands of AS Monaco.

item.title: Dubai to build $1.7B man-made islands
item.description: Dubai is growing again, and again it's building into the sea.

item.title: Supercar 'just feels supersonic'
item.description: "Supersonic" is how Nicki Shields, presenter of CNN's Supercharged show, describes the feeling of traveling in the world's fastest electric car.

item.title: Psychology of recycling: Why we may choose not to
item.description: Have you ever had your name spelled wrong on a disposable cup in a coffee shop?

item.title: How this artist stitches and molds her body
item.description: In Mari Katayama's provocative photos, a rare condition that she has suffered from since early childhood -- which resulted in an amputation of both legs at age 9 -- takes center stage.

item.title: New trail showcases 10,000 years of history
item.description: One of the best things to do in Jordan -- a new hiking trail reveals the country's jewels from north to south.

item.title: See in 360°: Separating Conjoined Twins
Trump lashes out over special counsel appointment
item.description: President Donald Trump lashed out Thursday at the appointment of a special counsel -- made by his own Justice Department -- to oversee the federal investigation into Russian interference in the 2016 election and possible collusion with his campaign.

item.title: Probe escalates: Ex-FBI chief appointed to probe Trump-Russia ties
item.description: A bad day for the White House could turn out to be a good day for justice and democratic accountability and institutions.

item.title: Storm swirls: Fresh questions over Flynn add to turmoil
item.description: Fresh controversy swirled around former US national security adviser Michael Flynn Thursday after one report claimed he told the Trump transition team he was under federal investigation before he started in the role, and another said he opposed a military operation in Syria that Turkey would have opposed while he was secretly in its pay.

item.title: Special counsel: What you need to know
item.description: The US Justice Department has appointed a special counsel to lead the federal investigation into Russian interference in the 2016 election, including potential collusion between President Donald Trump's campaign associates and Russian officials.

item.title: Analysis: An all-or-nothing deal for Republicans
item.description: The decision by deputy Attorney General Rod Rosenstein to appoint ex-FBI Director Robert Mueller as special counsel to oversee the federal investigation into Russia's attempts to influence the 2016 election and the possibility of collusion with Donald Trump's campaign officials amounts to a pushing of all the political chips into the center of the table.

item.title: Inside the White House: 'Chaotically dark'
item.description: No one inside the West Wing had to ask how the President's mood was on Wednesday afternoon as aides awaited his return from delivering the commencement address to the Coast Guard Academy in Connecticut.

item.title: Trump's co-author: He has to figure out a way to resign
item.description: In an interview with CNN's Anderson Cooper, Donald Trump's ghostwriter Tony Schwartz says that President Trump is having a meltdown and that Trump wants to figure out a way to turn a loss into a victory.

item.title: Ailes changed the media -- and America
item.description: On Thursday morning, Roger Ailes, the founder of Fox News, died. His passing is big news.

item.title: Ailes helped pave way for Trump's win
Grunge legend Chris Cornell dies
item.description: Chris Cornell, lead singer of Soundgarden and Audioslave, died Wednesday night, his representative told CNN.

item.title: Putin and Lavrov laugh about the US
item.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin made light of President Trump's "secrets" after it was reported that he shared classified information with Russian Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov.

item.title: Top court to rule on Islam instant divorce
item.description: India's Supreme Court decided Thursday to defer its much-anticipated decision on the controversial Islamic divorce practice known as "triple talaq."

item.title: Soccer star ventures into wine business
item.description: He's been likened to a fine wine who gets better and better with age.

item.title: Anorexia and alopecia can't hold back England rugby star
item.description: For England star Heather Fisher, the remarks -- however unintentional and well meaning -- don't get any easier to bear.

item.title: Millions at risk as climate change hits Great Lake
item.description: Standing on the steep rocky shores of Lake Tanganyika at sunset, looking out at fishermen heading out for their nightly lamp-boat fishing trips, it's easy to imagine this immense 32,900km2 body of water as serene and unchanging.
